# f5xc_infraprotect_deny_list_rule (Resource)

Creates a DDoS transit Deny List Rule

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_infraprotect_deny_list_rule" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the InfraprotectDenyListRule. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the InfraprotectDenyListRule will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `expiration_never` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--expiration_never))
- `expiration_timestamp` (String) Expiration Time (UTC). Exclusive with [expiration_never one_day one_hour one_month one_year] This deny list rule will expire at the given timestamp and will be removed from the system afterwards
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.
- `one_day` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--one_day))
- `one_hour` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--one_hour))
- `one_month` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--one_month))
- `one_year` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--one_year))
- `prefix` (String) Prefix. Prefix Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.ip_prefix_globally_routable: true

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_infraprotect_deny_list_rule.example system/example
```
